intro: Lotononis sabulosa, commonly known as the sand lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of white and yellow, often with a yellow center. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
